Handwheel

Contains logic to manage the machine handwheel.  In general, these subroutines are invoked by the machine runtime, but are documented here to support the occasional case for their programmatic use.

Functions
Initialize
call Handwheel.Initialize();

Sets up the handwheel for operation.  If the handwheel is not in an operable state due to the state of the machine, an error is generated.

SetEnabled
call Handwheel.SetEnabled();

Enables the handwheel for operation.  If the handwheel is not in an operable state due to the state of the machine, an error is generated.

SetDisabled
call Handwheel.SetDisabled();

Disables the handwheel from operation.

IsEnabled
call Handwheel.IsEnabled(
&IsEnabled
);

Tests the state of the handwheel

Response Parameters
&isEnabled

whether the handwheel is currently enabled
